citations.narrative:
The facility did not provide adequate shelter for the red pandas in early June. According to keeper notes, one hide
box/shelter had been provided to the two red pandas when they were moved to the exhibit on May 31, 2025. At this time,
the red pandas did not have access to indoor holding at night. Keeper notes on June 2, 2025 state that an additional nest
box should be expedited because resource guarding of their shelter-box had been observed. Keeper notes and veterinary
records state that a red panda outside of the single hide box was trembling and wet on the morning of June 8, 2025. It
had rained overnight. The facility states that an additional temporary shelter was added by June 10, 2025 to allow both
red pandas to have their own shelter if they did not want to share one shelter overnight.
Lack of sufficient shelter for each animal in an enclosure does not allow animals to protect themselves and could cause
discomfort. Natural or artificial shelter appropriate to the local climatic conditions for the species housed shall be provided
for all animals kept outdoors to afford them protection and to prevent discomfort to such animals.
Facility had corrected this noncompliance prior to the inspection. Maintain correction from August 18, 2025 forward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
SCOTT WELCH, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.127(b) 
   
Facilities, outdoor. 
The facility did not provide adequate shelter for the red pandas in early June. According to keeper notes, one hide 
box/shelter had been provided to the two red pandas when they were moved to the exhibit on May 31, 2025. At this time, 
the red pandas did not have access to indoor holding at night. Keeper notes on June 2, 2025 state that an additional nest 
box should be expedited because resource guarding of their shelter-box had been observed. Keeper notes and veterinary 
records state that a red panda outside of the single hide box was trembling and wet on the morning of June 8, 2025. It 
had rained overnight. The facility states that an additional temporary shelter was added by June 10, 2025 to allow both 
red pandas to have their own shelter if they did not want to share one shelter overnight.  
 
Lack of sufficient shelter for each animal in an enclosure does not allow animals to protect themselves and could cause 
discomfort. Natural or artificial shelter appropriate to the local climatic conditions for the species housed shall be provided 
for all animals kept outdoors to afford them protection and to prevent discomfort to such animals. 
 
Facility had corrected this noncompliance prior to the inspection. Maintain correction from August 18, 2025 forward. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
SCOTT WELCH, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
